title.en: Words of Truth for Pacifying the Ills of the Age

text.en: Through the blessings of the ocean-like Three Jewels and Three Roots,
text.en-trans: könchok tsa sum gyatsö jinlab dang

text.en: And the power of devas and sages, guardians of virtue and positivity,
text.en-trans: lha dang drangsong karchok kyongwé tü

text.en: May disease, famine, warfare and all the ills of this age of disharmony
text.en-trans: gyalkham küntu né muk tabtsö sok
mitün dü kyi güpa kün zhi né

text.en: May longevity, good health, happiness and prosperity abound.
May we have virtuous minds and ever-increasing dharmic activity.
May all infinite beings set out upon the path to awakening,
text.en-trans: tayé dro kün changchub lam la juk

text.en: And may we attain the state of fearlessness and great bliss.
text.en-trans: jikme dewa chenpö né tob shok

text.en: Dharmatā—reality itself—is perfectly pure from the beginning
And has never known any form of suffering or decline.
The Victorious Ones and their heirs, who see this truth,
text.en-trans: dendön zikpa gyalwa sé ché kyi

text.en: Possess great strength of aspiration and compassionate might.
text.en-trans: mönlam tu tsen tukjé tob chewé

text.en: Thus, with delusory perception and the ills of degeneration pacified,
May the wondrous light of auspiciousness, happiness and excellence
Pervade everywhere throughout the three worlds as a sign of splendour,
text.en-trans: sa sum küntu khyabpé getsen pal

text.en: Illuminating all, just like the sun, creator of the day.
text.en-trans: nyinmor jepa zhindu sal gyur chik
